You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Specify Whether to Activate and Price a Cloned Cart

When a buyer clicks the Clone button on a cart from the My Carts section of the My Account page, you can specify what happens to the new cart.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) only



USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

You can specify the following options for the buyer's experience after they click the Clone button:

Whether to price the new cart automatically after creating it.
Whether the new cart becomes active after creating it:
When the new cart is inactive, the buyer remains on the My Carts section of the My Account page.
When the new cart is active, the buyer immediately navigates to the Shopping Cart page.

These options can combine to affect the buyer experience in the following ways:

NEW CART'S STATUS	NEW CART'S PRICE DATA	BUYER EXPERIENCE
Active	Priced automatically	
The cart is priced during the Clone action.
When the Clone action completes, the buyer immediately navigates to the Shopping Cart page for the new cart.
For a large cart that's priced asynchronously, the Shopping Cart page can show a message that the cart is being refreshed while the pricing is in progress.

Active	Not priced automatically	
The cart isn't priced during the Clone action.
When the Clone action completes, the buyer immediately navigates to the Shopping Cart page for the new cart.
The Shopping Cart page shows an error the cart hasn't been priced.
To see the new cart's price, the buyer must manually reprice the cart.

Inactive	Priced automatically	
The cart is priced during the Clone action.
When the Clone action completes, the buyer remains on the My Carts section of the My Account page.
For a large cart, the cart can appear inactive while the Clone action and pricing are in progress.
When pricing is complete, the Sub Amount column in the My Carts section of the My Account page shows the new cart's price.

Inactive	Not priced automatically	
The cart isn't priced during the Clone action.
When the Clone action completes, the buyer remains on the My Carts section of the My Account page.
The Sub Amount column in the My Carts section of the My Account page shows a price of zero for the new cart.
To see the new cart's price, the buyer must navigate to the Shopping Cart page.

To configure the buyer experience for a cloned cart, update your storefront configuration settings.

NOTE First, verify that the My Carts section is available in the My Account page menu. See Allow a Buyer to Manage Their Carts on the My Account Page.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Cart (3).
Specify whether the new cart becomes active after cloning an existing cart. Find the Cloned Cart Page Behavior configuration (4), and find its value (5).
TIP
If the value is 1, the cart is inactive after it's created.
If the value is 2, the cart is active after it's created.
To change the current value, click Override in the Action column. Enter one of the following supported values, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Cart
Configuration	Cloned Cart Page Behavior
Page	all
Value	
1 to specify that the new cart is inactive and the buyer remains on the My Carts section of the My Account page.
2 to specify that the buyer immediately navigates to the Shopping Cart page.
Specify whether to price the new cart automatically after it's created. Find the Cloned Cart Pricing Behavior configuration (6), and find its value (7).
TIP
If the value is 1, the cart is priced automatically after it's created.
If the value is 2, the cart isn't priced automatically after it's created.
To change the current value, click Override in the Action column. Enter one of the following supported values, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Cart
Configuration	Cloned Cart Pricing Behavior
Page	all
Value	
1 to specify that the new cart is priced automatically after it's created.
2 to specify that the new cart isn't priced automatically after it's created.
Build and activate a new configuration cache.

Let us know so we can improve!

No
title: Configuring Cloned Cart Behavior in Salesforce B2B Commerce
